content.title: Solar Energy Corporation of India (SECI) Internship
content.department: Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
content.details: The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy launched the 'SECI Internship' program under Solar Energy Corporation of India Ltd. The Internship Program will serve as an opportunity for students to gain understanding about Renewable as a sector and SECI as an employer and help them evaluate future career opportunities. The Program will be structured, short-term, supervised placements often focused around particular tasks or projects with defined timescales. The work should be meaningful and must be mutually beneficial for intern and the Corporation.
benefits: Stipend: For training periods less than 6 months: ₹8,000/- per month
Stipend: For training periods from 6 months to 3 years: ₹12,000/- per month
Completion Certificate: HR issues a certificate upon successful completion of the internship, confirming attendance and work supervision.
eligibility: The applicant should be a student.

The student should engage in research/pursue Engineering Graduate & Postgraduate Degrees/Ph.D. students in Renewable Energy/CA/CA(Inter)/CS/ICWA/ICWA(Inter)/CMA students/MBA students in HR/Finance/IT/CC from recognized institutions in India or abroad.
The applicant must have his own laptop for the internship.
The applicant must maintain a regular schedule and demonstrate professionalism.
The applicant must sign a non-disclosure agreement to protect SECI's data.
content.application_process: Online. Application window will be open from 1st to 10th of each month.
documents_required: Letter from the institution confirming enrollment and 'no objection' for allowing their student to undergo Internship program.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the SECI internship?
faqs.answer: To provide practical experience and insights into the renewable energy sector.

faqs.question: Who can apply for the SECI internship?
faqs.answer: Students pursuing degrees in engineering, renewable energy, finance, HR, IT, and related fields.

faqs.question: Can I apply more than once in a financial year?
faqs.answer: No, you can apply only once per financial year.

faqs.question: Are there any fees for the internship program?
faqs.answer: No, there are no fees charged to the interns.

faqs.question: Is there any compensation for boarding or transportation?
faqs.answer: No, the internship does not include boarding or transportation compensation.

faqs.question: Can I apply offline for the SECI internship?
faqs.answer: No, only the online process is available.

faqs.question: How do I apply for the SECI internship?
faqs.answer: Apply online via SECI's website from the 1st to the 10th of each month.

faqs.question: Can SECI terminate my internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, SECI can terminate the internship at any time without notice.

faqs.question: Can I leave the internship program early?
faqs.answer: Yes, by giving seven days' prior notice to the Project Head/Mentor.

faqs.question: Will I get a job at SECI after the internship?
faqs.answer: No, the internship does not guarantee employment at SECI.

faqs.question: What should be included in the final report?
faqs.answer: A summary of your learning experience, suggestions for improvement, and any innovative ideas.

faqs.question: Who assigns the Project Head/Mentor?
faqs.answer: The Heads of Departments assign Project Heads/Mentors to interns.

faqs.question: What if I don't complete the internship?
faqs.answer: No completion certificate will be issued.

faqs.question: Are international students eligible?
faqs.answer: Yes, students enrolled in recognized institutions abroad are eligible.

faqs.question: What is the role of the HR Department?
faqs.answer: HR manages the internship program, including design, implementation, and modifications.

faqs.question: How many interns can a department take at once?
faqs.answer: Up to three interns, or six in specific cases like engineering/M-Tech/CA/CMA students.
